created: 03/10/98

CHAPTER 37—Applet Examples

This chapter has examples of using applets with graphics. The examples are intended to illustrate programming as well as graphics. There are only a few new Java features introduced in this chapter. Mostly it consists of using what you already know.

Chapter Topics:

  • Graph paper graphics
  • Using Graphics methods to draw a picture.
  • Calculating coordinates in a picture.
  • Loops in graphics programs.

In some of these examples, advanced features of Java could be used to great advantage. But let us use only the features that have been covered so far.

FRAGE 1:

Do great artists plan their art before they start working?
